title: Not able to RDP to servers if I disconnect and move to another machine and reconnect to the same session
author: ashlee-newton
body_snippet:
<!--- Provide a general summary of the issue in the Title above -->

## Expected Behavior
RDP to servers, disconnect from one machine, reconnect on another machine, and be able to pick back up with RDPing to servers.  


## Current Behavior
Signed into a PC on the Citrix server RDP to a few customer servers, disconnect my session, drive home, reconnect my session on a different PC, try to RDP and it will not allow me to.  It just opens a blank white screen until I close out all RDP sessio...

comments.snippet: Hello, mR uses standard windows protocol without any modification to it, so technically I don't see at the moment how this could be an issue from mR side. However question is if you open an rdp by mstsc for example on same citrix box, is it stay alive or have same symptoms?
comments.author: Kvarkas

comments.snippet:
Once a RDP session times out (e.g. missing network connectivity due to sleep), mRemoteNG closes the RDP session instead of keeping the tab with the remark "disconnected" unlike it does with SSH/Putty. 
But I'm not sure how much this can be improved upon within mRemoteNG as I guess the mstsc process exits instead of keeping running.

comments.snippet:
Hi Simon,
Existing RDP connections in MRemoteNG will continue to function after disconnecting and reconnecting to the Citrix session, even when the session moves between two different devices.

The only thing that doesn't work is initiating a new RDP connection when moving the session between two devices. However, new RDP connections DO work if we disconnect and reconnect the Citrix session while keeping the session on the same device.
